title: Synthetic Recap
body:
CHICAGO — On a night where the final score read 97-90, the story was written not by the Chicago Bulls, but by one man. Michael Jordan, defying time and logic, authored a performance for the ages, pouring in a staggering 45 points to single-handedly will his team to victory over the Atlanta Hawks.

In a game that often resembled a solo recital, Jordan was a symphony of scoring. While his teammates struggled to find their rhythm, His Airness was relentless, attacking the rim, hitting from mid-range, and carrying the entire offensive load for the reigning champions. The Hawks, led by Steve Smith's 24 points, had no answer for the onslaught. They played tough, they contested shots, but they were merely witnesses to history.

The supporting cast for the Bulls was subdued. Scottie Pippen managed just 13 points, and Dennis Rodman’s 14 rebounds were a quiet complement to Jordan’s virtuoso act. The contest was close, but it never felt in doubt because Chicago had the ultimate weapon. Every time Atlanta threatened, Jordan had a response, a bucket that silenced the run and reinforced his dominion over the game.

In the end, the stat sheet told the definitive tale: Jordan’s 45 points were not just a game-high; they were nearly half of his team’s total output. It was a historic, iconic performance, a reminder that even in the twilight of a legendary career, Michael Jordan could still transcend the sport and win a game by himself. The Bulls won, but on this night, it was His Majesty’s victory.
